meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The immovability of the heavy boulder made it impossible to push.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle's immovability gave it a sense of permanence.
meanings.sent3: The immovability of the stubborn donkey led to a comical standoff.
meanings.sent4: Her immovability in her beliefs was as solid as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The immovability of the massive oak tree was a testament to its strength.

meanings.definition: The state of being fixed or stationary.
meanings.sent1: The ship's immovability in the calm sea made it a peaceful place to rest.
meanings.sent2: The immovability of the statue in the park attracted many curious visitors.
meanings.sent3: The immovability of the traffic jam caused frustration among drivers.
meanings.sent4: His immovability in his decision surprised everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The immovability of the old lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
